article.title: In Photos | Nexus Staff Hometown Series
article.description: Our staff here at the Nexus has captured some photos of their hometowns to showcase their appreciation for their homes.
article.content:
In response to stay-at-home measures due to COVID-19, many UC Santa Barbara students have returned to their hometowns for spring quarter. Our staff here at the Nexus has captured some photos of their hometowns to showcase their appreciation for their homes. Their photos display the unique diversity in geography and landmarks present in each city including: San Diego, Los Angeles, Anaheim, Hong Kong, Buffalo, Newbury Park, Beijing and Temple City.

Check out the gallery below for pictures of each staff memberâ€™s hometown.

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

related.title: In Photos: Blue-Green Rivalry Ends in Tie
related.description: Harder Stadium filled with 11,424 people on Saturday for the Blue-Green Rivalry, breaking records as the largest crowd in the country this season for a menâ€™s soccer game.
related.content:
Josue Salgado clears the ball after a clean slide tackle. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

Kevin Feucht stumbles over Cal Poly defenders. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus

Nick DePuy and Jan Ilskens receive hugs while preparing for a corner kick. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

Members of the audience come up to the side of the field, cheering for the camera. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

Ahinga Selemani rushes to keep the ball from rolling out of bounds. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus

Sean Dhillon crosses the ball. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

Ahinga Selemani races for control of the ball. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

Fans cheer and tortillas are thrown after a favorable call. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

After leaping over a defender, Jeff Quezada heads the ball upfield. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus

The clean up crews had to work hard to keep the field clear of tortillas thrown throughout the game. McLane Brown / Daily Nexus

Jan Ilskens wrestles the ball away from Cal Polyâ€™s Justin Dhillon during the last minutes of the match. Courtesy of Kenneth Song

Titouan Le Roux anticipates his next move as the game goes into overtime. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus

UCSBâ€™s Lamar Batista and Cal Poly goalie Eric Kam battle to control the ball during the final minutes of the double-overtime match. Courtesy of Kenneth Song

Nick DePuy out-maneuvers the SLO defense. Eric Swenson / Daily Nexus

At the end of two overtime periods, the match was still scoreless. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus

UCSB librarian Margaret Rankin collects tortillas after the game. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus

UCSB Guest Services crew pick up tortillas after the match. Courtesy of Kenneth Song

related.title: In Photos: Yangs Walkabout Ghostly Streets
related.description: Chancellor Henry T. Yang and DillingÂ Yang joined Daily Nexus editor in chief Megan Mineiro onÂ Monday forÂ a walkabout Isla Vista.Â The Yangs accompany the Nexus each year to talk with students about...
related.content:
Chancellor Henry T. Yang and DillingÂ Yang joined Daily Nexus editor in chief Megan Mineiro onÂ Monday forÂ a walkabout Isla Vista.Â The Yangs accompany the Nexus each year to talk with students about their Halloween shenanigans.Â This year they ventured down deserted streets,Â witnesses to theÂ quiet Halloween that starkly contrastedÂ the rowdiness of partygoers common in years past.

Photos by Dustin Harris

Neither music nor partygoers could be found on Del Playa Drive Monday night.Â Law enforcement reported justÂ 46 citations and 26 arrests over the course of Halloween weekend, the majority for publicÂ intoxicationÂ or violation of the festival noise ordinance.

Â 

The Yangs interacted with the few students in costume walking down Del Playa. Nexus EIC Megan Mineiro dressed as Joyce Byers from the popular Netflix series Stranger Things, while the Chancellor said he was disguised as a grandfather.

Â 

Daily Nexus EIC Megan Mineiro and Chancellor Yang stopped toÂ talk with UCPD officers on patrol, as Officer Bly [center] reminisced about his time as a student inÂ I.V.

The YangsÂ took the time to stop and chat with multiple students they recognized during their walkabout I.V.

Â 

While 13,000 partygoers packed the streets of I.V. in 2013, numbers have sinceÂ declined to a couple thousand in 2014 and just over 500 in 2015.

Â 

Of the few students who took to the streets Monday night some used costumes as an opportunity to make political statements.
